executive_summary: Healthcare framework v4.0 significantly expands telehealth to all visit types including AI-assisted triage, upgrades encryption to AES-256, reduces breach notification to 30 days, mandates real-time safety reporting, improves nurse ratios to 1:4, doubles audit penalties, and introduces AI governance and price transparency requirements.

what_changed.change: Telehealth expanded to all visit types including initial consultations; audio-only permitted for behavioral health; AI-assisted triage allowed with physician oversight
Data security upgraded: AES-256 encryption, MFA required, breach notification reduced from 60 to 30 days, audit logs extended to 6 years
Adverse event reporting reduced from 72 to 24 hours; near-miss reporting now mandatory and real-time
Nurse-to-patient ratio improved from 1:6 to 1:4 for medical-surgical units; 24/7 physician availability required
AI governance requirements: clinical AI must have bias audit and explainability documentation
Fraud penalties doubled to $100K per incident; audit sample doubled to 10%; claim deadline shortened to 60 days
Price transparency and surprise billing protections mandated

action_checklist.action: Upgrade all systems to AES-256 encryption and implement MFA for all access points
Implement 24-hour adverse event reporting system replacing 72-hour workflow
Begin hiring to meet 1:4 nurse-to-patient ratio requirement
Audit all clinical AI systems for bias and create explainability documentation
Update telehealth platform to support audio-only visits and RPM capabilities
Publish machine-readable pricing files for price transparency compliance

risk_flags.why: Improving from 1:6 to 1:4 requires 50% more nursing staff. Current shortage may make compliance extremely difficult.
Many clinical AI systems lack formal bias audits. 12-month timeline for full compliance may be insufficient for complex ML models.
Halving the notification window from 60 to 30 days leaves minimal time for forensic investigation before mandatory disclosure.
